ygData.subject: RE: Cost of the Aqualung & Rebreather
ygData.msgSnippet: Er, both CP and PP are shown.  At any rate, great job Vapn!  Thanks for the run down.  Just the sort of math that needs to be shown to Varient as an example
ygData.messageBody:
Er, both CP and PP are shown. At any rate, great job Vapn! Thanks for the
run down. Just the sort of math that needs to be shown to Varient as an
example how Tinkering needs to be modified. I recommend forwarding this to
the development team or whomever.

Kilkin Cobblepot - 30th Gemchopper, Average Tinkerer - Fen Ro


-----Original Message-----
From: Zinken [mailto:zinken@...]
Sent: Tuesday, November 09, 1999 2:42 PM
To: EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com
Subject: SV: [EQ_Tinkering] Cost of the Aqualung &
Rebreather

From: "Zinken" <zinken@...>

Why do you write the cost on CP ? there is no reason in this
world to do that an it?s only confusing.


Askur of Veeshan

----- Original Message -----
From: Murr Rockstroh <mrockstr@...>
To: <EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, November 09, 1999 4:30 PM
Subject: RE: [EQ_Tinkering] Cost of the Aqualung &
Rebreather


> From: "Murr Rockstroh" <mrockstr@...>
>
> I would like to know where everyone is buying their
supplies since the new
> items cost me more than what I am seeing.
>
> Aqualung
> 189000 copper (189pp) Fine Coral Mesh
> 15750 copper (15.75pp) Silk Lined Steel Helm
> 1050 copper (1.05pp) Metal Twine
> 2887 copper (2.887pp) Gnomish Bolts
> 787 copper (0.787pp) Metal Rod
> 0 copper Fresh Fish
>
> 209474 copper (209.474pp) Total Cost
>
> Rebreather
> 209474 copper (209.474pp) Aqualung (this is assuming NO
failures on the
> Aqualung
> 157500 copper (157.5pp) Lime Coated Meshing
> 141750 copper (141.75pp) Sharkskin Tubing
> 91 copper (0.091pp) Firewater
> 15750 copper (15.75pp) Metal Fastening
> 367500 copper (367.5pp) Medium Plate Helm
>
> 892065 copper (892.065pp) Total Cost (this is again
assuming NO failures on
> the Aqualung)
>
> Now lets start applying some failure rates to the Aqualung
>
> At a 10% failure rate on the Aqualung goes to 232749, and
the cost of the
> Rebreather goes to 915340 (915pp)
> At a 20% failure rate on the Aqualung goes to 261843, and
the cost of the
> Rebreather goes to 944434 (944pp)
> At a 30% failure rate on the Aqualung goes to 299249, and
the cost of the
> Rebreather goes to 981840 (981pp)
> At a 40% failure rate on the Aqualung goes to 349123, and
the cost of the
> Rebreather goes to 1031715 (1031pp)
> At a 50% failure rate on the Aqualung goes to 418948, and
the cost of the
> Rebreather goes to 1101539 (1101pp)
>
> Now let's go one step further, since the above costs are
only figuring in
> the failure rate of the Aqualung. What happens when you
fail the
> Rebreather?
>
> At a 10% Failure rate on the Rebreather add 11% to the
above prices for the
> Rebreather
> At a 20% Failure rate on the Rebreather add 25% to the
above prices for the
> Rebreather
> At a 30% Failure rate on the Rebreather add 43% to the
above prices for the
> Rebreather
> At a 40% Failure rate on the Rebreather add 67% to the
above prices for the
> Rebreather
> At a 50% Failure rate on the Rebreather add 100% to the
above prices for the
> Rebreather
>
>
> So taking an extreme example, at a 50% failure rate on the
Aqualung and a
> 50% failure rate on the Rebreather, we are talking a cost
of 2202pp per
> Rebreather (that is Cost to make it, not what it would
actually sell for).
>
> Something to think about
>
> And if my prices above on the parts are wrong, please tell
me where you are
> getting them, since that is the price I get with a 110
charisma at the
> Windmills.
>
> Vapn Maistre, Master Tinkerer (well almost, stuck at 100
and out of cash)
>
>
